intro: Coccoloba polystachya var. mollis, commonly known as silky coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. This variety is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
